summary: This document details an interaction between attorney Bradley James Edwards and Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. Edwards is representing four women suing Epstein and has subpoenaed Rodriguez for documents related to the case. Rodriguez is attempting to sell these documents to Edwards, which leads to a planned consensual call involving an undercover employee.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.context: Edwards is representing four female individuals suing Jeffrey Epstein and has deposed Alfredo Rodriguez, serving him with a federal subpoena.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez was contacted by Edwards and is attempting to sell documents related to the case, despite being obligated to turn them over under subpoena.

persons.name: Gavin Gumbinner
persons.context: Gumbinner drafted the communication regarding the interaction between Edwards and Rodriguez.

persons.name: Frank Navas
persons.context: Navas is mentioned as an associate known to Gumbinner in the context of the investigation.

connections.description: Edwards is representing individuals in a lawsuit against Epstein and has subpoenaed Rodriguez for documents.
Rodriguez was an employee of Epstein, which is relevant to the documents he possesses.

events.title: Contact Between Edwards and Rodriguez
events.description: Bradley Edwards contacted Alfredo Rodriguez regarding documents related to the civil case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: Edwards served Rodriguez with a federal subpoena to provide documents pertinent to the case.

keyFacts: Bradley James Edwards is representing four women suing Jeffrey Epstein.
Alfredo Rodriguez is attempting to sell documents related to the case for $50,000.
Edwards informed Rodriguez that his demands for payment are illegal due to the subpoena.
A consensual call involving an undercover employee is planned to complete the transaction with Rodriguez.
